activities: Lexmark International, Inc. and/or its subsidiaries (collectively “Lexmark”) receives, stores, and/or processes personal data from the EU regarding Lexmark employees, customers, suppliers and vendors for business purposes involving finance and administration, sales and marketing activities, enterprise-wide IT services administration, and supply chain management. The personal information that Lexmark receives consists of human resources data, IT services user data, business contact information, and customer, supplier, and vendor records for purchase, delivery and sales of products and services, product registration, marketing research, order management, customer service and support, business development and relationship management activities, website analytics, and compliance with legal requirements.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: Computer & Peripherals - (CPT)Computer Software - (CSF)Printing & Graphic Arts Equipment - (PGA)Computer Services - (CSV)
recoursemech: American Arbitration Association (AAA), EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
